channel.title: fatih.ai on Fatih Kansoy
channel.description: Recent content in fatih.ai on Fatih Kansoy

item.title: Research
item.description: On this Research page, you’ll find my research interests: central bank communication, empirical finance, applied economics, and the economics of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Exciting News! Funding Granted for Innovative Research-led Teaching in Economicsâœ¨
item.description: I am thrilled to share that I have recently been awarded approximately Â£10K in funding from the Department of Economics for three dynamic projects, each designed to merge empirical research with educational innovation in finance and economics.

item.title: Macroconomics
item.description: This module provides students who have a mathematical background with an introduction to macroeconomics. It is taught using a mathematical approach, with the focus on providing an intuitive understanding to core economic theory, which will also include â€˜real worldâ€™ applications. Graphical analysis will also be used to illustrate key concepts, giving students a different way of examining problems that will complement the mathematics skills learnt in other modules.

item.title: Quantitative [Macro] Economics
item.description: This module provides students who have a mathematical background with an introduction to macroeconomics. It is taught using a mathematical approach, with the focus on providing an intuitive understanding to core economic theory, which will also include â€˜real worldâ€™ applications. Graphical analysis will also be used to illustrate key concepts, giving students a different way of examining problems that will complement the mathematics skills learnt in other modules.

item.title: Climate Change and Central Banks
item.description: This illustration brings together the concepts of financial market dynamics, monetary policy, central banking, and environmental sustainability.

item.title: Climate Change and Central Banks
item.description: I have updated the course outline for EC916 Topics in Global Finance. This course is designed for MSc in Economics students at the Department of Economics at the University of Warwick. This course is also available for MSc Finance & Economics students at the Warwick Business School.

item.title: EC916 Topics in Global Finace
item.description: I have updated the course outline for EC916 Topics in Global Finance. This course is designed for MSc in Economics students at the Department of Economics at the University of Warwick. This course is also available for MSc Finance & Economics students at the Warwick Business School.

item.title: Money and Banking
item.description: The course will relate this to recent economic events which have reverberated worldwide. It is particularly suitable for students wishing to enter careers in financial markets or further study in this area. The Money and Banking course will look at some key issues in the theory and practice of financial markets, monetary policy and banking and how their interactions affect the real world.

item.title: Understanding the Impact of Monetary Policy on Futures Markets
item.description: I have updated the course outline for EC916 Topics in Global Finance. This course is designed for MSc in Economics students at the Department of Economics at the University of Warwick. This course is also available for MSc Finance & Economics students at the Warwick Business School.

item.title: Macroeconomics
item.description: This module provides students who have a mathematical background with an introduction to macroeconomics. It is taught using a mathematical approach, with the focus on providing an intuitive understanding to core economic theory, which will also include â€˜real worldâ€™ applications. Graphical analysis will also be used to illustrate key concepts, giving students a different way of examining problems that will complement the mathematics skills learnt in other modules.

item.title: Finance in the 21st Century
item.description: I teach an engaging summer school course at the University of Warwick, specifically tailored for about 200 pre-university students from across the world. This course covers three significant areas: the evolving landscape of digital currencies like Bitcoin and their potential to redefine traditional monetary systems; the vital role of central banks in addressing the global climate crisis and maintaining financial stability; and the impact of big financial data, AI, machine learning, and algorithmic trading on financial markets

item.title: About
item.description: Learn how to get up and running using Hugo and Congo from a completely blank state. It’s the best place to start if you’re a new user.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: This section assumes you have already installed the Congo theme and are ready to start with basic configuration tasks like selecting a colour scheme, menu and content structure.

item.description: This section assumes you have already installed the Congo theme and are ready to start with basic configuration tasks like selecting a colour scheme, menu and content structure.

item.title: Homepage Layout
item.description: Congo provides a fully flexible homepage layout with built-in templates and the ability to provide your own.

item.description: Congo provides a fully flexible homepage layout with built-in templates and the ability to provide your own.

item.title: Front Matter
item.description: While supporting most Hugo defaults, Congo adds a number of front matter parameters to customise the presentation of individual articles.

item.title: Front Matter
item.description: While supporting most Hugo defaults, Congo adds a number of front matter parameters to customise the presentation of individual articles.

item.title: Shortcodes
item.description: Congo includes several shortcodes for adding rich content to articles including images, charts, diagrams, buttons and more.

item.title: Shortcodes
item.description: Congo includes several shortcodes for adding rich content to articles including images, charts, diagrams, buttons and more.

item.title: Partials
item.description: Partials are used to add special functionality to the theme including analytics, comments, favicons, custom scripts and more.

item.title: Advanced Customisation
item.description: Congo supports advanced customisations that include modifying the underlying Tailwind configuration, building the theme manually and providing custom CSS.

item.description: Congo supports advanced customisations that include modifying the underlying Tailwind configuration, building the theme manually and providing custom CSS.

item.title: Hosting & Deployment
item.description: Congo is designed to be flexible in almost any deployment scenario. Learn more about how to deploy your project to some common hosting platforms.
